intro: Tanacetum leucanthemum, commonly known as white chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white to pale yellow ray florets and yellow disk flowers, which give it a delicate and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces a fluffy, spherical bloom. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Tanacetum leucanthemum is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
